items.title: UK company shoots a 1000-degree furnace into space to study off-world chip manufacturing â€” semiconductors made in space could be 'up to 4,000 times purer' than Earthly equivalents
items.summary: British startup Space Forge has just successfully turned on its first in-orbit furnace, reaching 1,000 degrees Celsius in space. This is a crucial first step for the company in studying the feasibility of manufacturing chips in space.

items.title: Moto X70 Air Pro to get a periscope telephoto camera
items.summary: Last week, Motorola teased the launch of the Moto X70 Air Pro, and the company has now revealed additional details about the upcoming device. items.title: Equatorial Guinea pair banned for abusing referee at Afcon
items.summary: Equatorial Guinea's Carlos Akapo and Josete Miranda are banned for four games for abusing the referee after their defeat by Sudan at Afcon 2025.

items.title: Musk to expand xAI's training capacity to a monstrous 2 gigawatts with third building at Memphis site  â€” announcement comes days after Musk vows to have 'more AI compute than everyone else'
items.summary: Elon Musk has announced that xAI has purchased a third building at its Memphis, Tennessee site to bolster the company's overall compute power to a gargantuan two gigawatts.

items.title: Nvidia's CUDA Tile examined: AI giant releases programming style for Rubin, Feynman, and beyond â€” tensor-native execution model lays the foundation for Blackwell and beyond
items.summary: Nvidia's CUDA 13.1 introduces CUDA Tile, a new tile-centric programming path that elevates GPU kernel development above SIMT. The innovation aligns CUDA with the tensor-native execution model of Blackwell-class GPUs, and lays the software foundation for future architectures built around increasinglâ€¦

items.title: TikTok owner ByteDance to reportedly purchase $14 billion worth of Nvidia AI GPUs in 2026 â€” Company betting on Beijing's approval following Trump admin's ease on AI export controls
items.summary: ByteDance is reportedly planning to spend 100 billion yuan, or $14 billion USD, on Nvidia's AI GPUs in 2026. Specifically, Bytedance is eyeing up Nvidia H200 chips, following Washington's announcement that it will allow them to be sold to approved parties in China. Beijing still has to approve thesâ€¦

items.title: Women Directors Make Up 8% of This Yearâ€™s 100 Top-Grossing Filmmakers in a Steep Drop From 2024, Study Shows
items.summary: A new study describes 2025 as a â€œGreat Recessionâ€ for women directors, with just nine women directors attached to the 100 top-grossing films at the U.S. box office. According to the latest report from the USC Annenberg Inclusion Initiative, of the 111 directors who helmed those films, nine of them â€¦

items.title: How to connect an Xbox controller to your Windows PC â€” wired and wireless gaming made easy
items.summary: Game controllers on PC has come a long way since early serial and game port devices, and Windows now makes it easier than ever to get your game on.

items.title: Hojlund permanent Napoli move a 'formality'
items.summary: Striker Rasmus Hojlund completing his permanent transfer from Manchester United to Napoli is a "formality", says Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna.

items.title: Redmi Note 15 Pro series to be available in new colors starting Jan 1
items.summary: The Redmi Note 15 Pro lineup debuted in China in August. Now, months later, the Note 15 Pro and Note 15 Pro+ are receiving new color options to mark the New Year 2026 celebrations. Redmi revealed the new color options on Weibo, but they are also available for pre-order online via the official Xiaomâ€¦

items.title: 'Are you sure?' - Guardiola questions two-horse race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has questioned whether the Premier League title race this season is a two-horse race between his Manchester City side and leaders Arsenal.

items.title: Living the dream - Hood plans to open Chinese restaurant with Ally Pally winnings
items.summary: Justin Hood has enjoyed a stunning run on his debut at the PDC World Championship and he is closing in on his dream of opening a Chinese restaurant as a result.

items.title: Wolves earn shock draw at Man Utd to end losing run
items.summary: Ladislav Krejci equaliser earns Wolverhampton Wanderers their first point since October as they draw 1-1 at Manchester United.

items.title: Arsenal score four second-half goals to thrash Villa
items.summary: Arsenal score four second-half goals to beat Aston Villa 4-1 and end the year five points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

items.title: Brighton come from behind twice to draw with West Ham
items.summary: Brighton & Hove Albion come back from behind twice to draw 2-2 with West Ham United in a match that saw three penalties awarded in the first half.

items.title: Newcastle survive scare  to earn away win over Burnley
items.summary: Newcastle United survive a scare against struggling Burnley to end 2025 with a rare away win, beating the Clarets 3-1 at Turf Moor.

items.title: Garner & Barry score as Everton beat Forest
items.summary: Midfielder James Garner scores and sets up Thierno Barry as Everton condemn his former side Nottingham Forest to a third straight defeat.

items.title: NFL player Stefon Diggs faces felony strangulation charge
items.summary: Diggs "categorically denies these allegations," his lawyer said in a statement

items.title: Razer's Hanbo AIO coolers up to 70 percent off, drop as low as $29 in clearance deal â€” Chroma RGB CPU coolers fall to extreme budget territory, with 360mm model priced at $39, 240mm for $10 less
items.summary: Razer's old Hanbo Chroma AIO liquid coolers are selling at ludicrously low prices ahead of the new year as Newegg looks to liquidate all of its remaining inventory. Pricing on the 240mm model is just $29.99, making it possibly the cheapest AIO cooler on the market.

It is expected to make its debut on the Galaxy S26 series in Q1, 2026, and we now have some additional details regarding the 2600â€™s AI capabilities.
